abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project outcome is
            satisfactory with sustainability likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are considered highly satisfactory.
            Lessons for future adjustment programs involving difficult
            and politically sensitive reforms include: At the project
            design stage, the focus should be on conditionality and not
            on specific restructuring activities. Intensive discussions
            on conditionality help surface the areas of disagreement or
            resistance to change, and define the political space within
            which the reform operation will take place. The reform
            program must keep the long-term vision in mind but take a
            series of practical, achievable steps. Reform must be built
            on broad, multi-agency support, not narrow sectoral backing.
            The successes to date have depended on political support
            from the highest levels of the Argentine Government,
            including the president, a broad coalition of ministries,
            and a substantial number of the social health insurance
            funds and heath care provider associations. Crucial
            institutional development must be assisted through long-term
            technical assistance lending. Clear analytical work helped
            establish clear and achievable goals. Technical clarity and
            transparency was crucial in establishing a climate of trust.
            Equally critical was the intense supervision capacity that
            allowed the Bank to keep abreast of difficult political
            situations and to adapt design accordingly. Finally,
            introducing competition and tight regulation accelerated progress.

repnme.cdata!: Argentina - Health Insurance Reform Loans Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Health Insurance
            Reform Loans Project are to start a process that will
            improve the efficiency and equity of Argentina's health
            insurance system and to contain the already high level of
            health spending in the country. The loans will provide major
            support for the first phase of the health insurance reform
            by: 1) introducing competition into the market for health
            insurance, while avoiding risk selection; 2) reallocating
            resources in the Fondo Solidario de Redistribucion
            (Redistribution Fund) (FSR) to Obras Sociales (Social Health
            Insurance Funds) strictly on the basis of income and health
            risk of their insured households; 3) developing an effective
            regulatory framework and institutions for health insurance,
            which promote competition, ensure greater transparency and
            accountability and help to protect consumers' rights;
            and 4) extending to the Obras Sociales and Instituto
            Nacional de Servicios Sociales para Jubilados y Pensionados
            (National Social Services Institute for Retirees and
            Pensioners) (INSSJP) financial and technical assistance to
            enable them to raise their internal efficiency, improve
            their balance sheets, and comply with new standards and
            regulations. The project consists of three components: 1)
            policy reforms and regulatory development; 2) restructuring
            of the Obras Sociales; and 3) restructuring of the INSSJP.
